title: How to find out whether my partner is using dating sites - Quora

response.answer_text: Five Ways to Find out if your partner is using dating sites.  Find their email address and enter it in the “forgotten password” feature found on most websites and apps. This will not tell you if the individual is actively using the particular site or app however it will let you know they did at one point.Look them up by phone number. Most dating apps on Android and IOS are linked to the users phone number. Most people use Tinder and Bumble so I would start there. Try logging into the account using their phone number while you are hanging out and if they look at their phone then chances are they just receives a login verification code. Create an account in the same vicinity as theirs. This can be time consuming if there are many active users but you can certainly find them yourself. Start with the most popular sites and apps everyone uses. Keep in mind that if your partner also suspects you of using dating sites or apps this method could lead to some hard questions.Use a service such as albion-services or buzzhumble to do the searching for you. Sometimes a little professional help is worth a couple dollars. Take notes on how the individual uses their mobile phone. If there is a lock on their phone and they don’t receive notifications then chances are they are hiding something. Notifications being completely disabled is a huge red flag or if they always place their phone face down.I have a suggestion that may or may not work in your relationship. My policy is honesty and I set boundaries within the first month. I make it very clear that I want to be monogamous and that I don’t like secrets. Serious partners shouldn’t hide things. Some people go so far as to always keeping their social media accounts logged in on a mutual device and they share phone passwords. This may or may not work for you but if you show your partner you trust them completely they are much more likely to trust you back and there should be no excuses at that point.

response.answer_text: I am not a professional researcher (but maybe I should be), so my data is anecdotal and subjective, from personal experience only, and can be an IRL supplement to the technical methods shared by other respondents to this question. This is simply what I’ve noticed. If you and your partner are living together, and in general cohabiting if you are married, your path to discovery is easier than if you are partners living separately, although there is always that occasion when you return home after an evening out with your partner and discover to your horror that you’ve left your phone at your partner’s house. Major alert, requiring immediate corrective action, requiring you to drive back to their house and get your phone. After dating many divorced men and after a few dates, increasing our mutual comfort level, I asked how/why they became divorced. This is a common conversation: Me: “So how did your divorce happen?” Them: “I cheated.” [or maybe a more informative variant] Me: “How did your wife/husband find out?” Them: “I couldn’t find my phone and my wife/husband/kid found it”. Me: “Oh. Right. Of course they did.” But here are some other methods of discovery: 1.) Yes, of course, the most frequent situation for learning about your parter’s use of dating apps is, when in a hurry, you pick up the wrong phone and see an image of an attractive woman/man occupying the home screen. This only works if you and your partner have identical phones with identical cases. If your partner’s phone case is red, and yours is black then you would be less likely to grab their phone by mistake. 2.) If you try a dating site, in order to find out if your SO is participating, then of course you have to use a trial and error method because you cannot ask directly “now, what dating sites to you use?” Frequent swiping left and right, performed frequently enough can eventually turn up your partner in your daily feed of match wannabes. You and your partner would need to be using the same dating sites, though. However, this does not usually yield immediate results and can be labor- and time-intensive. You might be able to speed things up a bit by narrowing your search requirements to your specific location, where both you and your partner live. If you and your partner are using the same location, roughly, then your results would be limited to a narrower list than if you checked a range of “5 miles” to “100 miles”. 3.) You are researching something, looking for a specific screen, but you are having issues, or your phone’s battery is low, or you can’t find it and you need your phone right now but you have to wait until it at least charges to 10%. Then your partner, temporarily blind to the extreme dangers of phone sharing, tries to be helpful by offering their phone as an expedient. This solution is “expedient”, but for what purpose? Besides being a temporary hack to fix your problem, it is also “expedient” in apprising you of their dalliance. Items 1.) to 3.) above are all highly circumstantial and need a specific set of variables in order to work for checking out your partner’s dating site status. 4.) Just ask them, if you dare. Possible answers: a.) “Of course not, I’m with you, we’re a thing.” This takes a highly-evolved person to respond in a factual non judgmental way, but of course…if the person is highly-evolved you would not be having this conversation. b.) “OMG how could you even think such a thing?!” This implies that you are very insecure just by asking the question, and you’ve lost a few points in their opinion of you as a partner. This is a case of “If you have to ask, there’s your answer.” c.) A variation on b.) “OMG how could you even think such a thing?!”, which turns the issue back to your SO if they are the anxious one. This demonstrates their insecurity as they wonder if their performance is adequate, if they are showing enough interest, commitment, general participation in the relationship, because why would their partner be asking, unless they have fallen off the bandwagon. d.) And, OMG, the terminally sarcastic response: “Yeah, I keep the apps to cover any possible breakup with you, so I’ll be always current in my dating search”. This is so offensive it’s almost worse than if they actually were hanging out on the sites. Who wants to even be in a relationship with someone who dismisses your questions with such cavalier bravado. e.) “Yes, I am keeping them for a friend, who has to hide their dating app matches because they are married and don’t want their spouse to find out.” WTF?? Well what about when you find out, hmmm? You are a partner/spouse and you have already “found out”. You know, it’s exactly like that old story from high school, when your mother discovers your cannabis stash and you say “Oh it’s not mine. I’m keeping it for a friend”. In the same way, they might say: “Oh that dating app isn’t mine, I’m just using it for my married friend who doesn’t want their spouse/partner to find out.” These “how to’s” are, as mentioned above, circumstantial, and in need of corroborating evidence in order to be trusted, and, of course there is the “do nothing” strategy of simply waiting; your partner’s dating app status will be revealed and confirmed.

That is all well and good but here is a hidden indicator of cheating that most people are not aware of. First of all, a cheater when they are going to be undertaking this activity is going to make sure that they are not going to get caught. How do they do that? Some people make sure you aren't going to be around to catch them so they are going to be very keen on what your activity is and your location during that time so be aware when the other person in that relationship is checking your activity especially if they are not really jealous about it, sometimes a cheater will be happy that you are going out with your girlfriends or even with co-workers to make sure you are not around. It has been discovered long time in the investigative world when i am hired by a party to do surveillance on a spouse or domestic partner and clients never really had any reason to suspect cheating, so i have let's say a husband that calls up and say i want to do surveillance on my wife to make sure she is not cheating so i do my job and check everything out, not cheating and nothing is wrong and i call up the client and he's fine, no you know most of the normal response to it so what i do i do a little investigation and found out that about 20 percent of surveillance requests in a relationship scenario is what i call circle-back which means that the party that is hiring is actually not hiring to determine cheating and they actually hire to make sure that their spouse or other party is not circling back to catch them cheating so in this case the party will be so insistent on making sure they are not going to get caught, they want to keep tabs on their spouse to make sure they are not going to make sure they are not going to be discovered. So here's how you check that out, give a suspicious answer to questions on your whereabouts( i mean something that might trigger them normally) see if the other party is jealous because if the other party isn't it might be an indication that they don't really care about where you are, they are just glad that you have somewhere especially if they say what time will you be back or are you sure you gonna go. Those are the type of things that are indicators. Then watch their activities right after they ask these questions, if they ask you for example where you are going to be on a Thursday morning from 9 am to 12 pm, at 12:15 pm check them out to see where they are at, see if their back home, see if they are at work and maybe stop by at work to make sure they are there. Don't try to do surveillance during the period they are telling you about because they are going to be really suspicious of that, check them out right afterwards and if you want to if their hair's messed up, if they smell like perfume, if their car is parked in a different place that's the time to do it, don't try to do surveillance when the action is going on and see if they double check your location. Circle back is a cheater's worst nightmare, don't circle back and find them, find it out surreptitiously so you know the answer before they know you do and then you have more control over what happens because if they find out, they are going to be even more careful the next time and it is going to be even harder. It is advised that when hiring a professional you should seek a profound and experienced one like myself to avoid any future issue. Ask her and be upfront about why you're worried she might be. She's your wife, you should have open communication to talk about anything. It's wrong to go snooping. It can make you become obsessed with finding something even if there's nothing to find. I really don't recommend it unless you truly feel she's hiding infidelity from you. If you're really worried after speaking with her: You can check or ask to check her browser history and messages/emails. Ask your friends to keep an eye out if they're on dating sites. Look for signs; she hides her phone and gets angry if you try to look while she's on it, she goes out randomly and when you ask to go with, she insists you to stay home, she stops talking to you about issues or starts fights before leaving the house, she showers right away when she gets home. To fix things: If you're feeling insecure about the strength of your relationship, it's time to make some changes. You are married, you both deserve to feel appreciated, loved and respected. Don't hold onto what happened yesterday; each day is new and deserves a new opportunity to become close, not hold resentment with your partner. Try doing new things to bring intimacy, sex and romance into your relationship. Ideas: stay up all night listening to music (jazz, instrumental,etc), have a few drinks and laugh and talk. Really look at each other, lightly touch each other on and off throughout the night. Go to the beach, have a picnic, camping or find a great walking trail. Spending time outside with your partner is very important. Listen to the wind, water and animals and you'll find a sense of calmness and bliss. Enjoy the sun, the rain or the snow, give yourselves good memories of the seasons together. Really think about what makes your wife happy and excited. Give her a surprise. Make her laugh and smile. She wants to feel special, if you make her feel this way, she'll want to make you feel good too. Have a conversation about what your wants and needs are and come to a compromise. This conversation should come up at least once a year, since again we're always changing and so will the relationship. Really listen to and try new things with each other. It's important to be IN your relationship and not just on "autopilot" doing the same things and having the same conversations every day.

There are three types of guys that may use an online dating app. Guy number 1 is looking for a life partner he will look for someone that fits his ideal profile and is most likely an introverted person just looking for true love . Guy number 2 is the player he finds easy targets to have quick uncomplicated sex. There are no shortage of girls available online that can be easily swept into the bed and this guy knows how to get them there. Hopefully and surley after being in a relationship with this guy you would know what type of character he is. This type of person will most likely be a player online and offline so the signs will be there. Guy number 3 uses online dating as a confidence boost. Each match for him is a sign he still has sex appeal. Rarely will this guy follow through unless the girl can totally break through to his inner desires. But this is your more genuine type of guy and not online to be a player. Now this is all a basic breakdown. If your current boyfriend has had many online hookups via the dating app previously you will always be wary of him. If he truly loves you and is happy with you he will delete all his dating apps. If he does it in front of you ,you know he cares for you. All those tinder matches will be lost its a very good test of his true intentions. You may need to check his phone again in a few days to see if he re installed the aps but if they there again it's pointless he will always go back again. You can always try catch him out by getting some friends from work or school that live close to his radius to see if he's online show them pics and tell them you think he's messing around. Overall there are major issues with the way we hook up these days. It's a very sad situation the way sex is now a few clicks away. However it's not always that simple but it's definitely an addiction for many and something that needs to change before society is tarnished by the negative effects. By the way for girls it's much easier they have like 30 matches at any time so you can always download your own app have a few sexy pics and watch the matches come in. I'm not condoning this type of thing but you can always fight fire with fire. It's very ugly. Show him your matches that will make him think twice and delete your apps together. Good luck you sound like a decent girl rather find someone who you trust unconditionally. Damn you smartphones :)

response.answer_text: If your wife is on dating sites maybe that means she don’t love you any more. There are some signs.1. Gut instinct Your at this site for a reason. And unfortunately it's one of the signs that your wife is getting more distant from you 2. You have to clean up after yourself I know it's old fashioned but women tend to care more about cleanliness than men. So when she stops caring about that, it's a sign she's stopped caring about your marriage 3. She doesn't seem to really care that much You start to notice that any issues you are facing she's not interested in. For example; when you begin to feel under the weather, once she might have suggested you stay in bed and made you meals. Now she hasn't even asked you about it. 4. Physically distant – no kissing, hugging etc. If your wife is hesitant to hug or kiss you then this is a sign. To be honest this can be a little late as this is one of the latter things (in her mind) that she will withdraw from. 5. She doesn't initiate anything, ever If you find that she isn't organizing anything new in your family then she's losing interest 6. She stops telling about her day and her life Wive's love to use their husbands as a sounding board. To talk and get things off their chests… If she starts withholding this information then this is a sign 7. Lack of face time A loving wife loves face time because it shows her that you care about her. If she's seems not that interested in sharing time with you and would rather be on her phone/tablet, talking with friends or out doing something else then this is cause for concern 8. Guilt trips Do you feel guilty about going out, even to work? If when your leaving your wife and she is in an unhappy mood this can trigger things. This is a sign 9. Sketchy behavior Have you started to notice that your wife has a new ‘private life' that you don't have access too? This includes new email accounts, deleting history from devices, phone calls from numbers you don't know and even a second phone? 10. New wife Is your wife doing things she has never done before, or hasn't done in a while? I.e. joining the gym or buying a style of clothes that she hasn't worn in ages… maybe even new circles of friends?

If you were in a reasonably healthy relationship, the best way to find out anything about your husband would be asking him directly. Because you’re asking the internet instead, it seems like you don’t trust him and don’t feel like asking is going to result in a truthful or safe response. You could do all sorts of snooping to try to find out if your husband is using a secret email address and an assumed name on dating sites, but it won’t alleviate your pain or distrust. If you find nothing, will you believe he isn’t cheating or will you believe, instead, that you haven’t look hard enough? If snooping confirms your suspicions what will you do next? If you really think your husband is using a fake name and a secret email address to go on dating websites, why don’t you simply assume it’s true and take the next step, whatever that is? If you had proof, would you insist he stop cheating or would you file for divorce? Would you expose him to his family and yours? Would you set up your own secret dating profile as a weird way to even things up? If you believe he’s a duplicitous sneak, are you willing to be a duplicitous sneak to prove it to yourself? Implicit in your question is the insecurity you feel in your relationship. Don’t drive yourself crazy looking for evidence that your insecurity isn’t paranoia. Ask yourself instead if you’re willing to remain in a relationship in which you’re so deeply insecure, if you’re not just waiting around for him to leave you, or if you’re okay becoming the kind of person who feels the need to play detective and cop with her husband.

I really haven’t been in that situation, so I had to google some things around and I can say that I’ve found pretty impressive stuff. How to find out if someone is on a dating site 1. Create an online dating profile “I did not have to do that in my case as I didn’t suspect anything and my friend had come across his profile by pure chance. Nevertheless, not everyone is going to be as lucky as me. If you feel like something is different in your partner’s behavior, you might want to create a fake online dating profile and see if you can spot them on there.” 2. Change your information  “Don’t use your own photo, age, appearance features, or any other information that might lead him to that it is you. Many online dating sites allow the users to know who viewed their profile. You don’t want them to find out that you have been checking up on him. Be creative and change your information as much as possible. Don’t forget to also change your profession, education, personality traits, goals and other.” 3. Check the browsing history  “Another way on how to find out if someone is registered on a dating site is to check the browsing history. If you and your partner share a computer or any other device, you can check the browsing history and see what comes up. While a lot of people tend to delete their browsing history when they are hiding something, there is a chance they could have forgotten to do so. It is not a very reliable method, as your partner most likely would delete the history after being on the online dating site. However, if they did not erase it, you will have all the proof you need right there. Don’t try to access the device that does not belong to you as this is an illegal activity. These things are enough to help you out. I think that I’ve been of help somehow.

You can’t. At least, not without committing a federal crime. The only definitive way to determine whether she is on any dating site would be to get into her phone or computer, and check her internet browser history. However if you do this, especially without her knowledge or permission, and you get caught, you could be facing up to 20 years in prison and a fine $15 000 (in Canada). Therefore it is far better to just trust her, if she tells you she isn’t on a dating site, believe her. And if you don’t trust her, then the relationship is already over, because cannot work without trust. And even if she is on a dating site there is nothing you can do about it. Unless you have the time and money to constantly monitor her internet use (and even if you do, DON’T) she will find an opportunity to go on it. Therefore it is up to you to determine how you would want to deal with it. If you decide that you don’t like your girlfriend going on a dating site, then you break up with her. Or, you could you try to be secure in your relationship, know that going on a dating site doesn’t necessarily mean she’s cheating on you, that if she doesn’t want to be with you, then she would have already left the relationship, and that she does have the right to leave the relationship at any time she wishes, and there’s nothing you can do about it. Don’t worry about things you can’t control, all you should worry about is being the kind of guy she doesn’t want to leave, and build the kind of relationship she doesn’t want to leave, either. Good luck

By using the phrase, “other dating sites”, are you implying that there exists a list of dating websites he is allowed to be on , or did you mean to say “How do I find out if my boyfriend is using dating websites?” If you did actually mean the former, then you may also want to consider the fact that your boyfriend may also be the boyfriend of others as well. If you are OK with this, then I am unsure why him being on other websites would be more bothersome than this fact. If you actually meant the latter, which makes more sense to me, then there is somethings you can do to discern if he is on other sites. But before you begin, ask yourself why you suspect that he is, and if you have any real reason for that assumption. Once you begin down the path of mistrust and suspecting cheating, it is an arduous, if not impossible task for the relationship to continue. Tread carefully. If curiosity does get the better of you, download some of the more common apps, set the search radius to <1km and swipe through, provided of course that he is within that search radius himself. It is common to use fake names in scenarios like these, so you’ll have to be paying attention. Not on any of these apps? Try other sites. Remember this: don’t let your insecurities ruin your relationship. Make sure you have good reason to suspect this is occurring before you proceed. The more you feed it, and the slower you act, the deeper the mistrust grows. Nip it before it ruins everything.

This is one of those questions that has an obvious answer and generates an even more important question…  Answer: Ask them. Follow Up Question: Why don’t you ask them? Why did you think it was a better idea to ask a q&a forum vs. just asking them? Are they that hard to talk to? Would you not trust their answer? If not, why. My crystal ball says you will answer my questions with the following: “I have asked them, I brought it up because I suspect they are on dating sites. They just brushed it off and said “of course not” and if I try to bring it up again they get angry with me.” The bottom line: You don’t trust them. Short of them sharing all of their passwords on their computer and phone with you, and you searching dating sites you will never know. That’s what trust is all about. Why don’t you trust them? Two possible reasons: Because they are just untrustworthy, and have done things to betray your trust in the past. You already caught them with a rofile when they said they didn’t have one. Suggestion: Break up now. It doesn’t ever get any better, it just gets worse and you deserve the same level of trust/respect that you are giving.Because you see the world s you behave. You yourself are a bit paranoid and untrustworthy. You put yourself in their shoes and you see that you would cheat and be secretive. Suggestion: Break up now, get over these trust issues, love yourself and then give that new person to the next relationship and you won’t have to ask a forum about stuff like this again.

You don’t need to find out if they are using dating sites. If you are suspicious enough to be searching for ways to find out, the trust is dead. Either your partner is innocent and you don’t trust them, or they aren’t. Either way, the relationship is damaged. Either you catch them, or you continue to doubt. Conflict and suspicion are exciting and in their own way “fun”. You choose to keep participating in that cycle. You can do this drama, or you can have a trusting honest relationship. You can’t have both. And by the way, sometimes honesty is difficult. What if the truth is “sometimes I install tinder and look at people, then I feel guilty and delete the app”? That’s pretty common. It’s sad. It’s full of sadness and unmet needs and stuff they could spend hours talking to a therapist about. It’s also true and real, and something you could talk about and use to figure out how to be happier. If you can be honest and look past the surface reaction.

You can find out what sites he is visiting without snooping around on your husband’s phone or computer, or trolling online dating sites. Turn on the logging of your cable modem or wireless router. The logs in the modem/router probably show an internet protocol address. It will look something like: “123.123.123.123”. You can take that address and paste it right in to your browser, and it will resolve to the site. Try this - 129.42.38.10 (That’s IBM.) This is likely to work even if he is using his phone, since most people use their wireless connection to connect their smartphones to the internet when at home (saves data charges). In some cases the IP might not resolve because there is more than one website at that particular address. That is common in small sites. However, a popular dating site will have its own address.

Option 1: Ask her. If you have the kind of relationship where you are honest with each other,  this is the fastest and easiest.  The downside: Suppose you ask and she says "no I don't have an account. No matter whether she's lying or not, you've made the relationship weaker because she knows you don't trust her. If she lied then you still don't know. Suppose she says, "yes I do",  depending on what she uses it for,  you may be going down the road of splitting up (which might not necessarily be a bad thing).  Option 2:Find the account. Either see the app on her phone or find the account using a fake account and putting in all her attributes. This can be a huge time sink and might make you seem paranoid/untrusting. If you find the account,  then you know,  but if you don't find the account,  either it doesn't exist or you didn't look hard enough.  Option 3: Don't do anything. If she's using tinder to hook up,  you'll find out after a little while anyway. She'll slip up, especially if you're looking out for odd behavior.

The same way you find ANY profile…Start by Google Image searching some of his pictures. Often the profile picture used on social networking websites are used on dating sites as well, so start with that/those. Next, try searching his email address. The average person has 3 email addresses; 1 primary (Barbie_NaughtyPrincessXxX), one secondary for professional reasons (John_Smith), and one for spam (Tom_doe_spam123). So search his email address(es) on Google as well as other search platforms to see what pops up. Beyond that, you’d going to have to create an account and manually search through these sites to find him. If this is a mobile dating app, things can be a bit harder. Though you often have to link your the dating app to a social networking profile, these apps generally do not have a search or ‘find my friends’ feature. So you’ll have to toil through profile after profile to find him. Of course if he happens to see your profile first, this can be in vain if he blocks you before you have a chance to run into him. In short, there are methods, but at the same time there’s quite a bit of discouragement. There are a lot of dating sites and apps out there and this could turn into days or even weeks of searching and still you could come back with nothing.

First.  Just ask. If he is, discuss and if he is... work out new arrangements and boundaries.  If he's not, work harder in your relationship to ensure that there's no incentive to want to signup to a dating site. Job done...almost  Keyloggers and trackers can work to an extent use wisely. However it's a solution to a perceived problem.Typing an email address and random password into the login screen of some dating sites can produce false positives such as 'Your Password is incorrect' instead of 'Your username and password are invalid' This could give an indication that he may have possibly signed up.Check his email. Then use the forget password feature and reset the password.What I've found from experience, by being cheated on and being accused of cheating is that the best thing to do is assume he is on a dating site and don't get hung up about it.  Sometimes the effort of trying to find out outweighs the fact that you could just end the relationship and move on.

There are 100 answers so this might be a duplicate. If you’re suspicious, then you might as well search too, just in case you're right. Right? The problem with trying to find evidence of cheating is that not finding evidence isn't going to make your distrust go away. It's just going to make you think that sneaky bastard is sneakier than you thought and you'll just keep wasting more of your time looking for the smoking gun and driving yourself insane. You're never going to know for sure so just assume you would have found something and do whatever you would do if you did. Sometimes you get a feeling and you're right. Sometimes you're wrong. Well the short answer is ask him.  I think in relationships trust is very important, and if you have a feeling or if you think he might be on dating sites, you need to ask yourself why? Is this a "you" thing or a "him" thing.  If you've had bad experiences in past relationships regarding trust you need to look to the root of this problem and work on it yourself.  If your husband in the past has given you pause and you are considering this as an issue because it was in the past, then I think this is a bigger problem.  In either case this can be a serious issue if not taken care of, and this can corrode your relationship.  So instead of figuring out if he is on dating sites, once you've determined if the issue stems from you are him you can take appropriate action.  If it's your issues seek a certified therapist to discuss this with.  If it's him, you might want to have a dialogue with him and potentially you both should consider seeing a marriage counselor to help you settle this issue once and for all. Good Luck!
